intro: Melandrium qomolangmaense, commonly known as the Qomolangma catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in its harsh habitat. Due to its restricted distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical studies.
